page.title: 03HERMISGARTH: CATTLE & SHEEP
page.content: Mr.Muir owns one of the largest farms in Burness. This year he has{10 tons of{barley}which he will{bruise}so the animals can digest it. He will have {1500 tons}of{silage,}which he prefers to{hay}because the animals like it better. His{sheep}consist of{130 {Cheviot ewes, 7 Suffolk rams}& about {195 lambs}have been born this year. He has a{Charollais bull}&{130 breeding cows - he keeps {Hereford_Friesians}because they give good milk to the calves. In{winter}the cattle are fed{twice a day}- they eat about{25kg of silage}each time. They are{put out }into the fields in {April/May}&{taken inside}in{October/ {November}depending on the{weather}& the amount of{grass.}Some cattle are put to the{Mart}& some to the{Abattoir depending on which gives the best {price.
